author: {'steamid': '76561199217701920', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1659658878}
review: Доброго времени суток! Поиграл в данную игрушку около 18ч и могу с уверенностью сказать, что это обычный слешер для убийства времени. Играть в соло не очень интересно, но если у вас есть компания, которая готова поугарать, то это самое то. Сам же играл с девушкой, как и ей, игра очень понравилась. Есть недочёты, которые, честно говоря, раздражают очень сильно: Вылет игры из-за ошибок(самое интересно, что игра вылетала только на боссах), постоянный сброс настроек, иногда были моменты, когда надо убить мобов, но они то ли не спавнились, то ли были невидимые(были звуки их присутствия). А так игра очень хорошая. Ставлю 9\10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1703265199}
review:
Orc Attack: Flatulent Rebellion is a console ported multiplayer third person brawler which uses a bunch of artwork/asset ripoffs from Blizzard's "Orc" related games.  Really, it's a wonder Activision hasn't obliterated these guys from the unabashed ripoff. 

Regardless, the quality of the product is extremely low, and Microsoft need to be a bit ashamed here because they let this trash on Xbox.   The PC port is disastrously worse, and extremely buggy.  Controls are locked, generally requiring a controller (or not, who cares, this is so bad anyway).  The game thankfully crashes if you alt-tab to see if you did your 5 minutes to write a negative review for it. 

Nobody should buy this ever.

review:
오크 전사의 전투.

컨트롤 적인 부분에 아쉬움이 있다.
2개의 나무 몽둥이를 휘두르며, 주변에 다가오는 적들을 제거한다.

물을 무서워하는 오크라 특이하다.

컨트롤 설명에 키보드에 대한 부분은 없고,
패드 컨트롤러의 설명만 있어서  조금 힘들다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051572624', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1431571826}
review:
Press R on the keyboard and the enemies reset starting position.  Press Alt and the game hangs.  Press arrow keys to control character.  Press nothing to control camera, cause you can't.  Feels like someone sold me this game with debug settings ON.

No in-depth video settings, frame-rate is terrible.  

It's a port.  Still better port then Dark-Souls: Prepare To Lag Edition, but only in 2nd place....which is fkn terrible.

On the PC this is not a finished game.  Should have been flat out illegal to sell.

Perhaps it works as it should on the console, considering you can't change controls and all the how-to-play and control schemes are for a console controller.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083774673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1426440352}
review:
10 percet játszottam vele: 
- Nem lehet beállítani az irányítást, CSAK Xbox kontrollerrel fut. A billentyűzetes kiosztás jobbkezeseknek való, nekem kényelmetlen, és még csak le se írja hogy mivel mit csinálsz. Sima kontrollerem van, amihez automatikusan kiosztja a gombokat úgy, hogy a fele nem kap szerepet. Pl. nem tudtam benne ugrani sima kontrollerrel. Szokásos okádék konzolport, PC-n kiírja hogy nyomjak bal analógot.. kösz. 
- Vállalhatatlanul ganén fut úgy, hogy megvan az ajánlott gépigény. 
- A hangok valamiért rettenetesen elvesznek a háttérben

A legszánalmasabb dollár amit valaha költöttem, bár még egyszer biztos kipróbálom: De ha megtetszik sem fog érdemelni pozitív értékelést.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051336149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1410010292}
review: This is for xbox 360 and it schould stay there......

author: {'steamid': '76561198040247443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1423935239}
review:
It's an awesome little game to play with your friends/family on the xbox, seems broken on PC though.
It will give you Xbox 360 controlls even when you're using keyboard, so you have to work them out yourself.
Personally I used a pad, so I didn't encounter that issue, controller works 100% fine.
Also personally I put it on Magic mode, so I don't have to deal with unhumerous farts, but the game seems to pride themselves around it, so there's no real escape.
I played it on 360 with my brother, bought it on here as it was £1.74 and now I'm dissapointed with it.

Basically, if you're going to play this game on PC, you have to use a Xbox controller and find farts hilarious. No real story, nothing to be interested in, but there is an awesome little playable Minotaur who is awesome and makes the game a little but more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124386860', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1451692877}
review: unspielbar absturz immer bei jedem nächsten end boss

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1421125433}
review:
Orc Attack, Flatulent Rebellion, le genre de jeu dont le titre ne te donne absolument aucun espoir de rédemption, le truc qui a reçu des awards d'ont ne sait pas trop où qui ne donnent pas vraiment envie de se fier au jugement des gens. Tu le lances, tu comprends assez rapidement que c'est un port d'un jeu console, et qu'ils avaient tellement la flemme que si tu as pas un pad de 360, ben tu joues pas parce qu'il y a pas de support clavier. Heureusement tu as un pad 360, et tu te dis chouette, je vais pouvoir profiter du jeu. 
 
Dès le chargement, le jeu te propose de choisir, entre "crade" ou "magie", pour les âmes sensibles on peut remplacer ses prouts verts par des prouts bleus, dans les deux cas ça en dit long sur l'état du transit intestinal du héro, mais pour rester dans l'ambiance, on prend bien sur crade. 
 
Le jeu se lance, c'est dégueu, et là c'est le drame, tu découvres que la résolution par défaut c'est 1176x664, même les settings fournis avec le jeu sentent la merde à plein nez. Heureusement ça se re-règle, on se remet en 1080p des patrons, on se créé un perso et c'est parti pour l'introduction. 
 
Un petit défilé d'images de bon goût nous apprend donc que ces batards d'humain ont construit la nouvelle usine AZF à côté du campement de nos chers orcs, qui n'ont jamais vu ça, et pollué leur eau (plus que d'habitude, s'entend), ce qui a pour symptôme de plonger tout le village dans un état digne de lendemain de fête étudiante, caca mou, vomi et gazs mortels à chaque coin de rue. Les orcs tentent de se rebeller, mais les humains ont la technologie avec eux et leur mettent la misère, et leurs prouts incessants et odorants font qu'ils n'ont même pas la possibilité de s'enfuir, les humains pouvant les suivre à la trace. 
 
Pas de fuite possible, donc en avant la baston, c'est un brawler le plus basique possible, dans lequel on cogne sur des hordes d'ennemis stupides avec ses masses, lâchant de temps à autre un pet aussi odorant qu'inefficace par rapport à vos tatanes dans la gueule, une fois que tous les humains sont dégagés, on avance vers la prochaine zone et on remet ça, jusqu'à un éventuel boss qui conclue plusieurs dizaines de minutes de combat abrutissant. Les ennemis standards ont tous le même comportement, je les soupçonne d'ailleurs fortement de n'avoir qu'un seul code pour les gérer et que la pseudo-variance ne soit uniquement que des changements de modèles selon les zones, pour rendre le tout un peu plus vivant. Les modèles sont globalement assez stéréotypés, du viking à grosse barde à ... une sorte de mélange entre Bachelot et Taubira qui veut vous percer un deuxième trou du cul avec leur lance. 
 
On retrouve également le meilleur concept de tous les temps, à savoir la fameuse mission d'escorte, avec une subtilité ici cependant, puisque le mec que vous devez escorter est aveugle et qu'il avance en en ayant absolument rien à battre du décor, de l'éventuel absence de pont ou présence d'eau devant lui, et qu'il faut donc le baby-sitter tout en cognant tous les débiles qui vous attaquent, sous peine de le voir se suicider devant vous bêtement. Couplé à la maniabilité déplorable de votre perso, et à des phases de glissade en nenuphar sur des lacs mortels, l'ensemble fournit une expérience aussi explosive que la diarrhée de votre personnage principal. 
 
Entre les missions, on se retrouve sur une carte du monde un peu à la mario bros 3, en simplifié, avec une boutique dans laquelle on peut changer ses armes et son chapeau, et la possibilité de choisir les missions qui nous intéressent, dans des univers aussi variés que le froid, la foret ou le sable, qui ont chacun des petites particularités pour vous pourrir la vie. Le sable, par exemple, en plus de ses pharaons débiles, possède des momies invincibles qui ne peuvent être tuées qu'en utilisant vos rots, et qui lorsqu'elle vous touchent grimpent sur votre tête et inversent toutes vos commandes. Le mana ne remontant qu'en tuant des ennemis, et les zones étant bloquées tant que tous les ennemis ne sont pas morts, tuer tous les ennemis avant d'avoir tué les momies et rater son rot revient donc à rester bloquer comme un con dans le stage, sans autre possibilité que de le quitter puisque la progression est désormais bloquée. 
 
Ai-je parlé de la caméra ? Controlable en théorie avec le second stick, elle passe le plus clair de son temps à se réajuster derrière le personnage, ou devant, ou au dessus, selon ce qui pourrait être le plus pénible. Durant les fights avec certains boss, elle ne prend même pas la peine de les cadrer, et reste globalement collée beaucoup trop près du cul du personnage, la distance de vue n'étant pas ajustable. Boss qui, en règle générale, vous défoncent au corps à corps, ce qui est plutôt pratique pour un jeu dont 100% du combat se déroule au corps à corps, il faut donc esquiver leurs coups autant que possible pour pouvoir en placer quelques uns à soit au milieu de leur animation, en espérant ne pas se faire buter sous peine de devoir recommencer tout le combat, ce qui arrive assez régulièrement. 
 
La progression a tout de même un vague côté RPG, tuer des débiles donnant de l'expérience et parfois un peu de blé, l'expérience donnant des niveaux, qui eux-mêmes débloquent de nouveaux mouvements et des points vous permettant d'upgrader votre perso sur diverses stats à l'impact somme toute assez relatif. 
 
Orc Flatulent Attack est donc un jeu qui fait honneur à son titre. Il reste néamoins jouable, j'ai vu de pires bouses cachées derrière des titres moins merdiques, et je me dis que, ma foi, dans un univers parallèle, bloqué sur une console avec des potes et l'envie de se faire un brawler bourrin, mais dans lequel on aie rayé le disque de Gauntlet et déjà plusieurs bières dans le pif, ce jeu pourrait fournir un semblant d'expérience mémorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023916351', 'num_games_owned': 1655, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1401219975}
review:
I understand some games work better with a controller. I understand some games are harder to control with a keyboard. But I've never seen a game actually try and succeed in hiding the controller-keyboard mapping. The game tells you to press "X". You push all the keys until you find out it's "E". Or maybe "W". 

I gave up 10 minutes into the game, when it told me to turn the "R" stick around in circles. I couldn't find which key is the "R" stick.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996598947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1457313643}
review:
Bought this game because I thought it was an interesting premise.  Little did I know what was in store.
This game has more than a few problems.  Ranging from crashing when rejoining a game or having to completely restart the game to even join a game that you got disconnected from.   I had a friend only game going Initially but after I got a fourth player I had to make a public game because nobody was able to connect to me even though they were able to before.

The Camera is really weird.  It doesn't even try to keep at minimal the player who owns a copy of the game on screen.  I have ran into multiple occasions where I can still see my friends on screen but I have managed to walk offscreen and was no longer visible on the camera.

One of the game's more used moves.  The earthquake is tied directly to the stick that controls camera movement which I thought was stupid as heck.  Because to use the earthquake you have to jiggle said stick.

However one of the more glaring problems is that for the other players the game had somehow messed up their computers to the point that they had to restart them.

The one positive I will give this game though is that at least the graphics look nice but that doesn't really help with a game this bad.

All told this is a badly programmed game and as neat as the premise seems.  I really wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961494531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1400193098}
review:
This game is just utter crap, though I suppose you can assume that from the title itself. While it does have some interesting mechanics behind the basic beat-em-up action, the way it's put together makes it fall flat.

Here's a quick look video if you'd like to see for yourself what this game is. But if you'd rather have something more concise, then read my review below.

http://youtu.be/E0PSS7T-ln8

I'll first start by telling you the basic concept of this game. You're an orc who is having his land overrun by humans, who have also poisoned your home and given everyone terrible gas. Mind-blowing, I know, but stay with me. It's now your job to take back your lands with violence and flatulents. And that's pretty much the whole reason behind this game.

Okay, so maybe the story isn't the best. What else did you expect from game with this title? What you should be getting these kinds of games for is simply the gameplay itself. So what do you do in this game exactly? You fight wave after waves of enemies until you reach a boss or the end of the level. It's that basic. 

But let me tell you what makes this bad. To start, the enemies that you will repeatedly be hammering the attack button against are all pretty much the same. You may go do a another level and they look different, but they're still the generic grunts that mindlessly swarm around you and try staring at you to death. Sure, some may have a hammer instead of a sword, but they still act exactly the same. Even the ones with shields you can treat the same as the ones without. After a few quick swings of you clubs, the shield is gone and they act exactly the same as everyone else. It's just boring. And the worst part is that you have to trudge through far too many waves of these punching bags that have way too much health for their own good.

Still, you may stumble upon an interesting enemy every now an again like mummies or archers, but even they have their problems. The mummies for instance, you can only kill with your toxic gas. Alright, that's well and good. But if you happen to be out of magic and have nothing left to kill to regain it, you're pretty much screwed. Or if the mummy happens to grab you in a mess of the generic trash mobs, you have to play an annoying game of rattle your controller stick to get him off. And while you're doing this, the mobs keep attacking you and resetting your work until you die and have restart the bloody level again in the hopes of it not happening once more. The archers themselves were fine since you had to use a moving barricade to get close to them, but when I did, I noticed arrows magically coming out of their frozen bodies and heatseeking me. A very sad sight indeed.

Okay, so maybe the enemies aren't the most interesting things. What about the combat itself? I do like the fact you can use the environment to your advantage and blow up your farts to great effect. I also like how you can pillage shields and weapons sometimes that give you different movesets. All well and good. But what I don't like is that the most effective move/combo in the game is simply ramming the quick attack button over and over again. Nothing beats it. Sure you may get an interesting belly flop move or charge attack that leaves you open afterwards, but you'll always do more damage and be more efficient just hitting that one button. So ultimately, you'll be doing the same thing start to finish.

What makes this much worse is the awful pacing of the game. After spending several minutes pounding on the same horde of dudes over again, you'll most likely be met with another just down the way. They're not even quick to get to you. They run at a snails pace just like your character, so you spend a good while just waiting for them to reach you. And when you're not fighting trash mobs, you're doing waste-of-time platforming such as riding a painfully slow lilypad down a creek or waiting for an electric fence to let you into the next area. There's even one escort mission where you simply fart around until the dude you're escorting finally reaches the next point he has to be. And even when you beat a boss, you're not just given the rewards. You have to wait for them to randomly drop on the floor across the arena, then you're stuck with the chore of having to roll around and try to pick them up before they disappear. It was like a slap in the face after trudging through the entire level.

But now that we're on the topic of bossfights, I might as well tell you about them. While they are gonna be the most interesting enemies you encounter, they're also likely to be the ones to show you some of worst mechanics behind this game. I'll start by saying there is no way to cancel an attack once you're swigging so you can dodge, so you have to be patient and time everything accordingly. While some may like that commitment to attacking, it can be the most frustrating thing to watch as your orc lazily charges up his attack as the boss telegraph his next move that you won't be able to dodge. And when you do get hit, expect a good 7 seconds of not being able to do anything as your orc lays on the ground. It makes the whole boss fight a chore as they cycle through the same few patterns over and over again.

Now I've said a lot already, but let me put another few items down that rubbed me the wrong way.
*The game crashed on me twice. Once when I was simply changing the resolution and graphics to high, and another time after a beat a level. 2 gamebreaking bugs in one hour, and one was even in the first minute. Not a good start.
*While I like the fact you can level your orc the way you want it, all you're getting to choose is basic stats and nothing that modifies the way the orc is played. It doesn't help that the game really doesn't tell you how effective the upgrades are either.
*One of the resurrection items makes you play the dumb minigame of waggling your controller before a 10 second timer runs out. What the heck was the point of that?
*Some of the tooltips telling what to do are needlessly long and too frequent. They don't help the already terrible pace of the game.

So yeah, that was a lot of bad. But what does this game do alright? 
*I like that the orcs have different special abilities such as freezing, flaming, or petrifying gas. They just need more to flesh them out and make them different.
*I also like that there is online and local coop. More people playing the game together always makes things more fun, though I doubt the online is gonna be very active.
*The brawling is actually alright. Things are hit and react the way you expect them to. It's just the little variance makes it super boring after the first hour.


So in summary, the negatives of this game far outweigh what it does right. You may have a chuckle at the concept for the first level, but then you'll suddenly realize that it's lost its charm. But for some reason you still want this game, at least wait until it goes on sale. That way you'll have little to regret if it doesn't suit your tastes.
